ReportManifest.Name: Infographics Report - Surgical Safety

Column.Name: Number of times a surgical tool was accidentally left in a patient's body during surgery
How often the hospital accidentally makes a hole in a patient's lung
How often a surgical wound in the stomach or pelvic area split open after surgery.
How often patients accidentally get cut or have a hole poked in an organ that was not part of the surgery
Number of patients who get a blood transfusion and have a problem or reaction to the blood they get
Antibiotics given one hour before surgery
Preventing low body temperature during and after surgery
Right antibiotics given to surgery patients
Urinary catheters removed on the first or second day after surgery
Surgery patients prescribed treatment to prevent blood clots at the right time
